key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares mostly align with the website (68–72% parity), though missing fares increased 28%, and about 14–16% are cheaper by roughly 7%.
MSE undercuts the website on over 95% of itineraries, shows minimal unavailability, and has very limited fare parity.
GDS sees about 68% matching fares, a slight uptick in missing fares to 3.5%, and a rise in lower fares from 9% to 12%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Nearly 68–72% of fares match the airline website, though this share dipped slightly.
Missing website fares rose 28% from last week, reaching about 1.8% of itineraries.
About 14–16% are lower on OTA, typically by 7% compared to the website.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA N/A up by 28% vs. last week, reflecting increased missing fares.
Dominant at 68–72%, though a slight downward trend continues.
14–16% of itineraries are cheaper on the OTA, undercutting by roughly 7%.
Up to 14% of cases, commanding an 8–9% premium.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 67%+ of fares match, with a slight uptick in OTA-lower fares and about 2% missing.
Same fare share is 74%, up 5%, while OTA-lower remains under 10%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 68% match, 14% cheaper on OTA, both edging up from last month.
65% parity, with OTA-lower exceeding 27%—stronger discounts outside SA.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Same-fare rate down to 65%, missing fares slightly higher, OTA-lower near 17%.
About 72% parity, OTA-lower at 13% and growing modestly.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over 95% of MSE fares undercut the website, showing broad discounting.
Matches occur only 2–5% of the time.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Below 1% of itineraries, consistently small gap.
Low single-digit parity, with minor weekly changes.
No higher fares in the dataset.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 95–98% cheaper on MSE, stable weekly shifts.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 95–98% cheaper on MSE, small parity changes.
Even higher MSE-lower share, above 97%, minimal parity.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: At least 94% lower fares, parity stays below 6%.
95–98% cheaper, slightly higher advantage than close-in.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 68% of GDS fares matched the website last week.
Missing fares at 3.5%, a slight uptick but still low.
GDS-lower fares grew from 9% to 12% of itineraries.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 3.5% of itineraries, a modest increase from last week.
15.7% of fares, up 1.6% from last week.
12.2%, a 2.8-point rise from last week but below last month's rate.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Same fares drop to 68.6%, GDS-lower over 12%.
Same fares climb to 68.8%, GDS-lower retracts to 7.6%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Same fares down to 66%, GDS-lower rises above 13%.
Same fares near 83%, leaving minimal GDS-lower space.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Same fares slip 6% to 68%, offset by slight gains in GDS-higher and GDS-lower.
70% remain aligned, GDS-lower edges up to 9%, GDS-higher at 14.7%.
